Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he holds about the agricultural, and his feelings towards farmers. This film also portrays his innocent childhood and the fraternal relationship between Miyazawa and his younger sister.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, whom Alice has brought from abroad, comes with an ancient Egyptian amulet around its neck that, when touched, transfers one’s emotions to the one touched.
